SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am16
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.cli

Class CLIText

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.cli.CLIText
public class CLIText extends Object

Utility class to store and manage colored Command Line Interface Assets. A CLIText should be thought of as a matrix of characters where each character can have its own color. Please note that this class works best with odd widths and heights because assets with odd lengths have a well-defined center.

This class only works well if ANSI color escape codes are available on the terminal that is used to run the CLI; behavior is otherwise unspecified (it might work without the colors, or it might print seemingly random characters).

  • Constructor Details

    • CLIText

      public CLIText(String[] text, String[] colorMask)
      Creates a new Command Line Interface asset with the given text and color mask. The two arrays given should have the same length, and every string in the arrays should also have the same length.
      Parameters:
      text - An array containing each of the text's rows.
      colorMask - An array containing the color mask of each of the text's rows. The available colors are:
      • K for black;
      • R for red;
      • G for green;
      • Y for yellow;
      • B for blue;
      • P for purple;
      • C for cyan;
      • A blank space for the terminal's default text color.

    • CLIText

      public CLIText(String text)
      Creates a new single-line, all white CLIText. This is useful when a line of text will have to be merged with a more complex CLIText.
      Parameters:
      text - The single line's content.

    • CLIText

      public CLIText(String text, PlayerColor playerColor)
      Creates a new single-link text that is colored with the given PlayerColor.
      Parameters:
      text - The single line's content.
      playerColor - The color to color this text with.

    • CLIText

      public CLIText(String[] text)
      Creates a new, all white CLIText. This is useful when colors are not needed, such as when creating position labels.
      Parameters:
      text - An array containing each of the text's rows.

    • CLIText

      public CLIText()
      Creates a new, 1x1 empty CLIText. Useful when contents will be merged later on.

  • Method Details

    • mergeText

      public void mergeText(CLIText toMerge, int startRow, int startCol)
      Merges the given asset into this asset, replacing this asset's contents when the two overlap. This method also expands this asset as needed to fit the new asset.
      Parameters:
      toMerge - The asset to merge into this asset.
      startRow - The row where the top-left corner of the new asset should go.
      startCol - The column where the top-left corner of the new asset should go.

    • expandLeft

      public void expandLeft(int toWidth)
      Expands this asset to the left with blank spaces up to the specified width (for example, if the asset is currently 5 characters wide, passing 7 as a target width will add 2 blank spaces to the left of every line).
      Parameters:
      toWidth - The width to expand this asset to.

    • expandRight

      public void expandRight(int toWidth)
      Expands this asset to the right with blank spaces up to the specified width (for example, if the asset is currently 5 characters wide, passing 7 as a target width will add 2 blank spaces to the right of every line).
      Parameters:
      toWidth - The width to expand this asset to.

    • expandUp

      public void expandUp(int toHeight)
      Expands this asset upwards with blank spaces up to the specified height (for example, if the asset is currently 5 characters high, passing 7 as a target height will add 2 blank spaces to the top of every column).
      Parameters:
      toHeight - The height to expand this asset to.

    • expandDown

      public void expandDown(int toHeight)
      Expands this asset downwards with blank spaces up to the specified height (for example, if the asset is currently 5 characters high, passing 7 as a target height will add 2 blank spaces to the bottom of every column).
      Parameters:
      toHeight - The height to expand this asset to.

    • printText

      public void printText()
      Prints this text to System.out without a bordering frame.

    • printText

      public void printText(boolean frame)
      Prints this text to System.out.
      Parameters:
      frame - Whether to add a thin frame around the printed text.

    • addFrame

      public CLIText addFrame()
      Creates a copy of this CLIText with a frame added all around it.
      Returns:
      The new asset with the frame added.

    • addFrame

      public CLIText addFrame(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Creates a copy of this CLIText with a frame around the specified area.
      Parameters:
      startX - The frame's top-left corner's x-coordinate (the column).
      startY - The frame's top-left corner's y-coordinate (the row).
      endX - The frame's bottom-right corner's x-coordinate (the column).
      endY - The frame's bottom-right corner's y-coordinate (the row).
      Returns:
      The new asset with the frame added.

    • color

      private String color()
      Injects the ANSI color escape codes into the asset and unifies the whole asset into a single string.
      Returns:
      A print-ready version of the asset (including new-line characters).

    • spacesString

      private String spacesString(int length)
      Creates a string of spaces of the specified length.
      Parameters:
      length - The length of the string to create.
      Returns:
      The created string of empty spaces.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of this asset for debug purposes. Use the printText() method and its overloads for actual printing.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns:
      This asset's current width. Can change if it is expanded via merging new assets or calling the expandLeft(int) or expandRight(int) methods.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns:
      This asset's current height. Can change if it is expanded via merging new assets or calling the expandUp(int) or expandDown(int) methods.

    • getOriginX

      public int getOriginX()
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of this asset's origin. The origin is the point where the asset started, before anything was merged into it.

    • getOriginY

      public int getOriginY()
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of this asset's origin. The origin is the point where the asset started, before anything was merged into it.

    • getClone

      public CLIText getClone()
      Returns:
      A deep copy of this CLIText.

    • getSubText

      public CLIText getSubText(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Extracts a part of this text, useful when only a portion should be printed.
      Parameters:
      startX - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangular portion that should be extracted.
      startY - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangular portion that should be extracted.
      endX - The x-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangular portion that should be extracted.
      endY - The y-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangular portion that should be extracted.
      Returns:
      The extracted portion.

    • playerColorToChar

      public char playerColorToChar(PlayerColor playerColor)
      Utility method to convert from PlayerColor to a character color code used by this class in the color masks.
      Parameters:
      playerColor - The player color.
      Returns:
      The character color code equivalent to the given player color.
